stories.text:
I've been keeping an eye on the job market trying to help some early-career friends find new or first jobs. It seems like almost every company only has "Senior" or "Staff" job reqs posted.

Is the junior / new-grad market so crowded with potential hires that those roles get filled immediately? Or is there something else that explains the seniority trend?
stories.title: Ask HN: Why are job reqs trending so senior?
Google search spam for 'Bill Slawski obituary' shows the dark side of SEO

Teach Your Kids Poker, Not Chess

stories.text:
Whatboard: https://www.whatboard.app

After a year using Whatboard internally to visually close & manage over $4m in sales and complex projects, its with great trepidation we birth this thing on HN to face our missteps. We tried many solutions over the years and apart from the long ago FB consumed and discarded drop.io, nothing fit our needs.

How we sell with Whatboard (at our sister company): https://whatboard.app/b/singleviewselling

How we delegate with Whatboard (at a related entity): https://whatboard.app/b/singleviewdelegation

Thank you in advance to anyone in the HN community interested in providing feedback, and to a certain 14 year old Gracklflint whose QA participation with our dev team made this even more enjoyable.
stories.title: Show HN: Sell and delegate visually, distraction free with Whatboard
In memory of Vernon “Vern” D. Buerg
